sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标准"之意。
means: standard ： 指公认为决定事物质量或人的品质的准则或原则。
criterion ： 较正式用词，指判断、批评事物的标准，但不一定制成了规章。
measure与standard基本同义，但多用于比喻，指衡量某事物的质量准则。
gauge ： 专指测量物体大小、厚度、直径等的标准规格。

sentence.Network_en: Senior managers stipulated work-life balance as their main criterion when choosing jobs.
sentence.Network_cn: 高级经理人把工作与生活的平衡作为择业的主要标准。

sentence.Network_en: The main criterion is value for money.
sentence.Network_cn: 主要的标准是钱要用得划算。

sentence.Network_en: Only social practice can be the criterion of truth.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有社会实践才能是检验真理的唯一标准.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Greek kritērion 'means of judging', from kritēs (see critic)

entry.def: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something.

example.ex: The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their own work...
example.tran: 最重要的参赛标准是申请者必须设计并制作自己的作品。

example.ex: British defence policy had to meet three criteria if it was to succeed.
example.tran: 要想奏效，英国的国防政策必须具备3个条件。

means.word_mean: 1. a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated;

sentences.sentence: "they set the measure for all subsequent work"

means.word_mean: 2. the ideal in terms of which something can be judged;

sentences.sentence: "they live by the standards of their community"

auth_sentence.content: Every country had a different criterion, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every country had a different criterion, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every country had a different criterion, he said.

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Panero is managing editor of the New Criterion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr. Panero is managing editor of the New Criterion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr. Panero is managing editor of the New Criterion.

auth_sentence.content: He is executive editor of the New Criterion.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is executive editor of the New Criterion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is executive editor of the New Criterion.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 批评的,评论的;危急,紧要的;临界的
stems_affixes.word_buile: crit判断,分辨,评判+ical……的→adj.批评的,评论的;危急,紧要的;临界的
crit判断,分辨,评判+erion→做出判断的依据

stems_affixes.value_cn: 批评家, 评论家, 吹毛求疵者
stems_affixes.word_buile: crit判断,分辨,评判+ic人→n.批评家, 评论家, 吹毛求疵者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 评论性的文章,评论;批评,指责,非难
stems_affixes.word_buile: crit判断,分辨,评判+ic+ism行为,现象→n.评论性的文章,评论;批评,指责,非难
hypo在……下面+crit评判+e→在背后评判→伪君子

Sentence.sentence: At the moment candidates are selected on a fairly narrow set of criteria such as prior academic and career performance, and analytical and problem solving abilities.

means.word_mean: (批评、判断等的)标准，准则，尺度

sentences.en: What criteria do you use when judging the quality of a student's work?
sentences.cn: 你评定学生功课好坏时用什么作标准?

jushi.english: What criteria do you use when judging the quality of a student's work?
jushi.chinese: 你评定学生功课好坏时用什么作标准?
